name: Rattle King
description:
Introduction

Rattle King is the best of all the canyons draining this mesa. All natural anchors or ghostable with Sand Trap and fiddle stick. Keep in mind that sometimes, leaving webbing can be preferable to leaving scars from fiddling.

Approach

From the Burr Trail walk north into upper Long Canyon. You'll want to get yourself to here, 37.928278, -111.240333, and then make your way WSW up onto the Wingate. It's a bit complicated and finding the correct route the first time will likely take a while. Some of this portion will be 4th or easy 5th class scrambling. From here on tread with consideration for the fragile ecology. Walk on stone or in water courses where possible. It's better to step on comparatively hardier plants than crypto soil crust.

Descent

The head of the canyon has three possible entry forks. I prefer the middle one because it doesn't have any brush in it. There are a couple of large boulders or a small natural arch for anchors. The second drop is from a small natural bridge partway down a chute. A while ago some large boulders fell into this part of the canyon making it trickier to access the bridge. A sand trap works well at the third drop. Below that the canyon slots up nicely and includes a couple more natural bridges. The last drop to the ground has a large, nasty bush blocking the stream course. Either anchor off the bush or climb up to the right and rappel over the cleaner wall from another anchor.

Exit

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

Background

I've never seen signs of other people having descended this canyon but...
